page.title: 09Maiden Castle today
page.content: Archaeologists have discovered that people lived around Martinstown thousands of years ago. Maiden Castle was an Iron Age hill fort providing shelter and protection to its builders Maiden comes from the word Mai-Dun, meaning stronghold. It was invaded when the Romans came to Dorset around A.D 70.Soon after, the Romans built their own settlement near the River Frome. They called it Durnovaria. It is our town of Dorchester. Today Maiden Castle is both a popular tourist attraction and a place where people go to exercise their dogs, enjoy the view or stagger up the ramparts in an effort to keep slim. The winter of 1985 brought another invasion to Maiden Castle, this time by enthusiastic tobogganists enjoying the snow.Cows still graze the top of the monument.
